DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no indicator whether peripheral neuropathy was present at the time of randomization.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to peripheral neuropathy being present.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.:A disorder affecting the cranial nerves or the peripheral nervous system.  It is manifested with pain, tingling, numbness, and muscle weakness.  It may be the result of physical injury, toxic substances, viral diseases, diabetes, renal failure, cancer, and drugs. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: On or near an edge or constituting an outer boundary; the outer area.

A disorder affecting the cranial nerves or the peripheral nervous system. It manifests with pain, tingling, numbness, and muscle weakness. It may be the result of physical injury, toxic substances, viral diseases, diabetes, renal failure, cancer, and drugs.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Clinically significant periph
ReferenceDocuments.description: Clinically significant peripheral neuropathy at the time of randomization

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have pre-existing Grade 2 or greater peripheral neuropathy

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have peripheral sensory neuropathy or peripheral motor neuropathy greater than Grade 1 per Modified Balis Pediatric Scale

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have pre-existing grade 2 or greater sensory or motor peripheral neurotoxicity?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have greater than Grade 2 neuropathy according to the modified (Balis) pediatric scale except in cases in which neuropathy is secondary to prior surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have pre-existing peripheral neuropathy grade 1 or higher

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have symptomatic peripheral sensory neuropathy >= grade 2 (CTCAE v4.0) with no prior oxaliplatin therapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have symptomatic peripheral sensory neuropathy >= grade 2 (CTCAE v4.0)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have symptomatic peripheral sensory neuropathy >= grade 2 (CTCAE v5.0)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have peripheral neuropathy >= grade 3?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have symptomatic peripheral sensory neuropathy greater than or equal to grade 2 (CTCAE v5.0)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have pre-existing peripheral neuropathy grade 2 or higher

DataElement.changeDescription: Replaced VD Assessments Ind-2 2018320v1.0 with VD ID#3506068 - Yes No Indicator - dbw
